channel.title: C++ on Allen's Whiteboard
channel.description: Recent content in C++ on Allen's Whiteboard

item.title: C++ Key Points
item.description: This is the first post of my ambitious plan trying to enumerate as many key points about the C++ language as I can. These notes are only for personal reviewing purposes and shall definitely be used commercially by anyone interested. Comment below for any missing C++ syntax or features. üëçüèª Header Basically there’re only one thing that needs attention. For standard libraries we use < and > and for local libraries we use quotes.

item.title: How to Build C++ Projects with STDIN in Sublime Text 3
item.description: I’ve been a die-hard fan of Sublime Text (ST), all the time from the 2nd to the 3rd version now. To be frank, I use ST in almost all situations: taking lecture notes in LaTeX, drafting small projects in Python or R (while for large projects, Jupyter Notebook and RStudio are stronger platforms), or tracking my Todo-list in Markdown. Everything works so smoothly and lightly with ST, especially compared with IDEs like Xcode or Visual Studio.
